website_summaries.verdict: A portable option that allows you to have a composting toilet available where you need it, when you need it.
pros: Has separate compartments for liquid and solid waste
cons: The vent line is a little short for use in some campers
you may need to buy a longer one

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this toilet to be installed in my Class C RV. There is no way I am going to be emptying a black tank! The Nature's Head Composting Toilet is larger than the toilet that came in the RV, and the guys that installed it had their doubts as to whether it would fit in the space, but it just fits allowing me access to the bathroom. I've attached a picture. Nevertheless, I can get in and out of the bathroom and use the toilet comfortably, so I'm happy. The toilet is easy to use, and best of all, I only have a gray tank to empty. Yippee!
customer_reviews.author: CathyAnn

customer_reviews.title: Great product. must sit to pee Including guys!!!
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Works like it says. Worth not having a black water tank in ya rv to empty. Completely mobile if ya want it to be. Fyi you must sit to pee. Including guys. If you stand and pee it gets drops of urine splashed on the back, to which it trickes down and in the poop tank. This will cause it to get soupy over time and smell. Not one tells you this. That has been the only hang up with this product.
customer_reviews.author: april

customer_reviews.title: I like this toilet but for almost a thousand dollars I ...
customer_reviews.text: I like this toilet but for almost a thousand dollars I would have changed a few things. I added no-see-um netting to the intake and exhaust of mine and also replaced the stock .07amp fan with a .15amp fan that seems to blow 4 times the amount of air. I was worried about back draft on my mobile application. Additionally I had to buy a mushroom vent that didn't come with the kit. For the price I paid everything should have been included. It does work though, and my poop doesn't stink. Clean it with a little vinegar and you're good to go.
customer_reviews.author: warewolff

customer_reviews.title: Great improvement to our motorhome
customer_reviews.text: Great improvement to our motorhome, now we can dry camp for an extended time without going to a dump station due to a full black water holding tank. Where we stay all we need is to resupply the fresh water and food. ( nobody needs a black water tank to shorten the stay ) If you can't drain your gray water where you stay your black holding tank can be put into gray water service which gives you two gray water tanks. Think about all the fresh water you put into the black water holding tank, fresh water is for drinking and washing.
customer_reviews.author: J. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Almost two years and still think it’s a great upgrade from a flush toilet and nasty black tank.
customer_reviews.text: Installed in our class C RV. Best upgrade one could ever do to an RV. Would never go back to a nasty black tank. Edit: March, 2020. Still working great. We’re full timers and coco coir can be hard to find so we stock up when we do find it. Solids side works better in low humidity. Only overflowed the urine tank once in two years. Totally our fault. Thank goodness for the secondary container or we would have had a terrible mess. We’re getting ready to move up from our class C to a fifth wheel and we’re definitely putting the old toilet back in and moving the Natures Head to the new rig.
customer_reviews.author: R. O'D

customer_reviews.title: working great!!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! We installed the head on our sailboat. It was a pretty painless. We also installed solar vents in the dorades above the head. It's working great! Great to have those smelly hoses and tanks gone.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: It's expensive for a design that should be evolving
customer_reviews.text: It seems to be working well. I've Had it completely hooked up for to weeks now. It was a let down to get such an expensive unit without both electrical hook-ups, and most inconvenient was the exhaust; fitting with standard ABS is a pain ☹️ I watch a bunch of videos with people building a riser around their old toilet drop 😆 come on people it's just for screws, and it's out of the way; the toilets tall enough 😂 My next step is to order a spare fan 😄... Just in case.
customer_reviews.author: aaron

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Product
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic product. Replaced old toilet in Airstream trailer and it is great. Small size, easy to install and no water needed. Watch the YOU TUBE video for this product and you will be sold. As more and more years are drought here in California I believe we may all have to have these toilets even in our homes. Why use valuable drinking water to flush!
customer_reviews.author: Lori A Myers

customer_reviews.title: Not the most comfortable, but should get the job done.
customer_reviews.text: We replaced the water flush toilet in our Freedom Express Ultra Lite, because we didn't want the hassle of messing with a black tank. Installation required that I switch the fan to the opposite side, which was quite easy to do. Also required making a spacer for bottom so that it would sit flush over the existing flange in the floor. I also sealed the hole in the floor flange with a 4" plastic plug from Lowes, and sealed it with some caulk. Space was bit tight in our installation, but we're satisfied with the end result. It's nice that the fan cord unplugs so that we can disconnect when not in active use.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Excellent composting toilet! Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using it for 6 weeks or so. Works perfectly, and NO odor. Zero, zilch, nada. I travel and live full time in my trailer, and it's great to not need to frequently find a place to empty the black tank. An added bonus for me is that I don't need to use up my water for flushing the toilet, making the fresh water last waaaaay longer. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: planetmango

customer_reviews.title: (DO NOT USE IN HUMID CLIMATES)
customer_reviews.text: We have been using this toilet in our RV full time for 3 years now. This composting toilet worked very well while we were in non humid climates. For the last year we have been in South Carolina where the humidity kept the toilet from working properly. We ended up for months having to replace the solids on a daily basis to keep the moisture out. That got extremely expensive because we use coco coir. That did not stop the bugs though. If you are going to be using this in a non humid climate, I would say buy it. Do not use it if it will be in a humid climate.
customer_reviews.author: Tina Pringels

customer_reviews.title: This changes everything
customer_reviews.text: This is the solution I was looking for and solves one of my biggest concerns about dry camping. Check out the You Tube voids on it. All true. It is a bit pricey but I think in the long term it will pay for itself if you don't have to pay to dump black water. Another side benefit is that by adding a single valve over your dump discharge tube, you can leave your gray and black valves opened increasing your gray water capacity. My wife and I can boondocks for a month before we need to empty it.
customer_reviews.author: mike kepper

customer_reviews.title: Just not a great concept...
customer_reviews.text: We use this daily, and there are five of us. As to the solid waste compartment, it takes about a month to fill it up. The urine side fills up daily. For us, or even less people using it regularly, it's simply not large enough to compost in any real way with how often you have to dump it, so it's less a "composting toilet" and more of a "poop bucket you will dump into a compost bin." The little silver flecking in it isn't very stylish either. Otherwise, it does a good job at keeping odors out and is more or less easy to use, if difficult to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Swartz

customer_reviews.title: Annoyed that these things didn’t just come with it for ...
customer_reviews.text: The toilet works well, but the installation process was FAR more complicated then we thought. Had to buy a separate av plug in and then cut a hole in our camper to run the exhaust tube out. Now we have to buy a cover to go on that to keep bugs from getting in. Annoyed that these things didn’t just come with it for how much we paid.
customer_reviews.author: Marissa Byrd

customer_reviews.title: Great to get rid of holding tank.  Poor electrical
customer_reviews.text: This unit is great to get rid of a smelling holding tank on boat. The urine bottle needs to be emptied daily. The solids section only emptied once during intermittent summer use. The electric connection on the fan failed after 5 months of use. 11/9/2017 Customer service is immediately sending out new fan with improved electrical connection...so raised rating to 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Booms

customer_reviews.title: Awesome highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: LOve it so far! Comfortable and easy to install and use. Only difficulty was figuring out how much composting material to put in, directions were a bit vague. Separating my pee and poo times were not as difficult as I thought. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME & Seriously NO smell!
customer_reviews.text: We'd been thinking & researching & finally purchased this brand, so worth the anticipation. It is easy to use and really truly no smell. We have this in our cabin & can't make it up to it every weekend, and seriously thought oh my gonna be stinky. Not so. The it customer service is amazing as well.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: No customer support
customer_reviews.text: Ordered May 30, 2020, shipped early June and neither Amazon nor seller can tell me where my $900 toilet is, other than "it is shipping and due June 29". Today is July 18.
customer_reviews.author: Ginni Diaz

customer_reviews.title: Works well but overpriced
customer_reviews.text: Works well but very pricey. I installed the toilet in a very remote location and used a solar RV bathroom vent (also bought on Amazon) and seems to do the trick. No smell (other than slight “earthy” smell as reported in other reviews). Toilet is easy to install and use, even for kids. Follow manufacturer’s instructions and you should not have any issues. My only complaint about this product is the price. In my opinion the appropriate price point should be half what it is. A friend made his own composting toilet out of plywood for $30. That is an option if you’re handy. If this product were more fairly priced I’d give it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Blackbeard

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the money.  Easy to use / easy to clean.
customer_reviews.text: Great product for the money. Easy to use and easy to clean. Company calls back quickly if you have any questions or concerns. Would highly reccomend if you are looking for a composting toilet.
customer_reviews.author: wolf-spirit

customer_reviews.title: Pretty cool commode that doesn't use any water
customer_reviews.text: This thing is pretty cool. Waterless, and can provide a lot more time away from water. Can really extend dry camping time. I use it as my main toilet, and it is very easy to maintain. But it's just me. Fluid is in the bottle, and solids go into the composting media. There is a tube and fan that provides constant fresh air to dry the solids. And the smell is not what one would think. Out of the tube smells more like a dirt, an earthy smell. Not sewage.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Not Rady For Set Up With Household Electricity
customer_reviews.text: Paid a good price and then had to pay more and wait longer to have the transformer that powers the fan to be mailed. It is shipped with a connection to a solar power battery, I think, but if you want to plug it into a wall socket call and order the transformer as it can not be bought local as the end plug is a small odd size. Also, be sure to use a composting aid to make clean out as easy as can be with these type items. Does save water and plumbing for sure
customer_reviews.author: John S

customer_reviews.title: Look forward to replacement in a few years.
customer_reviews.text: I had this toilet installed in my RV five years ago. I’ve just replaced it with a new one. Same model only this time I purchased it from Amazon and installed it myself. This toilet has the same issues as the previous one. Extremely difficult to clean. It’s made out of the same material so it will acquire stains which cannot be removed. Wish there was something else better to choose from.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Camper

customer_reviews.title: Awsome
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical! This composting toilet has surpassed my expectations! I installed it in my sail boat, spent 3-1/2 weeks cruising, with 3 on board. The Head preformed flawlessly! No need to empty. The pee tank is a bit smelly to empty, but not bad if emptied every couple days. It is easy! Installation was easy as well. It took longer to remove the old head, hoses and tank! No more smell on board! I used the old tank space to put in a new water tank! Best money ever spent!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great design that stands out from
customer_reviews.text: The design on this composting toilet is excellent. It had great capacity and is easy to install and clean. It is well built and has a solid design. However, the materials themselves (mostly formed plastic) don’t justify the high cost. I suspect this toilet could be built for much less $$$ but it’s still worth the cost because of the excellent design separating liquids and solids.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as described
customer_reviews.text: We were sad we actually never got to “use” this product. We had intentions on installing it onto our boat but hurricane Michael came along and messed our plans up. We ultimately ended up having to return it because we no longer had a boat to put it onto, but we did open the box when we received it and I did get a few pics and a video. Hope it helps anyone in deciding if they want to try it out or not, we plan on purchasing again for our next boat because we felt like it was going to be perfect for us.
customer_reviews.author: Mandy

customer_reviews.title: It’s takes the hassle out of sewage control.
customer_reviews.text: Ok I’ve had this for 7 months now. I just emptied it the second time. Peat moss worked better for me. This time for emptying was summer. It had 0 smell dumping it . If someone didn’t know they would use their hands. I’m serious. I’m a live aboard on a sail boat. I don’t even think you need the fan in the summer as I had to keep adding water to make it easier to turn the mixing handle. There was nothing to clean up ! I love this toilet!
customer_reviews.author: Zephyr

customer_reviews.title: Its a lot to deal with, it gets you off grid.
customer_reviews.text: Its important to know what you are getting into with these, do the research because honestly they can get real nasty real fast with more than 1 or 2 people or if you have kids full time RVing. Its more of a give and take sort of deal, you have to weigh if it's worth it for you and if you like that sort of maintenance. After a few years of trying this we tossed it and celebrated never having to empty and clean it again or worry about gnats getting in. Its a pain as much as the black tank imo.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas W.

customer_reviews.title: Nature's Head is Perfect ! Works incredibly well !
customer_reviews.text: All positives ! Incredible composting toilet. Sits at ADA height, easy to use, easy to clean, fan works as advertised and fan exhaust hose can be set to exit on either right or left side. All parts well molded and ergonomic. This toilet will last longer than my motorcoach. No more black water hookups or cleaning for me!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... a Mercedes Sprinter 170 conversion and have nothing but good things to say about how much better this makes ...
customer_reviews.text: We installed this unit in a Mercedes Sprinter 170 conversion and have nothing but good things to say about how much better this makes traveling. Easy to hook up the venting system. Uses so little power and there is zero smell from unit. I can't believe people still install flush toilets in their RV's today with composting toilets available.
customer_reviews.author: Kayra P.

customer_reviews.title: Worthless system
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this for 3 months in our RV and it is a.nightmare! The fan has been replaced 4 times and keeps failing. Causing flys and odors. My dream trip through Canada will be cut short due to these issues and lack of assistance from Natures Head. They claim to have 50 distributors world wide but the one in CA is a guy working out of his house. Tried replacing the fan at electronic stores but the size required is NO LONGER MFGD! The amount of money we spent for the system and additional bottle and tank was significant and this has been an EPIC FAIL.
customer_reviews.author: Martha Regan

customer_reviews.title: Needs very little help.
customer_reviews.text: Size sucks. A few more inches forward. You know what I mean? You can improve a great idea send me your revisions for approval before releasing to public. Or if you like, I'll do it for you. Let me know. Sincerely Scott
customer_reviews.author: Scott Friel

customer_reviews.title: pricey
customer_reviews.text: natures head is making a TON of money with their price point mark-up. i suspect they have a price agreement with their only real competition "airhead", an almost identical product and the same inflated price.
customer_reviews.author: Rick N.

customer_reviews.title: Just what we needed.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install, good urine separation system and odor free with our 1 person, five days a week usage.
customer_reviews.author: r reed

customer_reviews.title: Odor free and durable
customer_reviews.text: Very will built .2 of us have been using this daily for several months now and it’s really easy to live with.before buying I was concerned with possibly odor issues or cleaning issues and neither of those are an issue at all. I really can’t find any faults with this at all period great product well designed and durable It will no doubt last many many years
customer_reviews.author: Chad Corbett

customer_reviews.title: Learning curve for use - Off Grid
customer_reviews.text: Used in a converted cargo trailer ("Full detailed review on YouTube, search "Texas Tramper"). Works GREAT!! However, I'm in South Texas heat and humidity so gnats are a BIG problem IF fan in unit is not running! Must ALWAYS keep fan in unit running. Absolutely no odor. Because it isn't used daily, I dump urine bottle at the end of every weekend. Purchased a spare bottle so as to take one home to dump and clean while the other is installed for use. Definitely a learning curve - for women too - in getting good at hitting the front two holes. for suggestions, watch my YouTube video. Feel free to ask any questions.
customer_reviews.author: Texas Tramper

customer_reviews.title: ... alot of research before purchasing it and am completely satisfied. Using it in a camper for my son ...
customer_reviews.text: I did alot of research before purchasing it and am completely satisfied. Using it in a camper for my son to live in year round. So far it's great! Plan to buy another for a different project soon.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Close

customer_reviews.title: A composting toilet worth every penny.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product. Simple installation. Easy use and maintenance instructions. The manufacturer is great to deal with on after-purchase advice, parts, service.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Toilet
customer_reviews.text: If there's such a thing as a perfect toilet, this would be it! Installed it in my Sprinter Van conversion and it works exactly how I wanted it to. No smell. Easy to clean. Easy to manage.
customer_reviews.author: Robert G.

customer_reviews.title: Seems very well built
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted one of these and after much time and deliberation I found the best of the best. It is in my RV and I highly recommend it. Only have had it for a month or so, but It should last forever.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Rembowski

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Been using it for 1 year and wouldn’t trade it for the world!
customer_reviews.author: Rosemarie Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: We purchased for our cabin and it was one of the best Purchases we have done.
customer_reviews.author: Bluejade

customer_reviews.title: Quiet and odor free
customer_reviews.text: I do like the Nature's Head Self Contained Composting Toilet. My only drawback is the fact that the description said that the Toilet is good up to 80 uses before cleaning is required. I live by myself and I installed the unit during the last week of October and I have not been able to go any longer than two weeks before I have to clean it. Other than that, I must stay that this Toilet is very quiet and there is absolutely no smell.
customer_reviews.author: John B.

customer_reviews.title: Coconut husk you need like 3 or 4  squares
customer_reviews.text: I have a barn and I need a bathroom I love it is easy and convenient We had 6 people and it worked just fine no smell and the bathroom was in side the barn 👍
customer_reviews.author: ivonne ramirez

customer_reviews.title: Needs to be alittle bigger.
customer_reviews.text: It's well built and not so easy to use. I understand that the main use for these are for cramped quarters or tiny house's, but I'm a big person and being big it's hard to cover my parts if you know what I mean. I'm making it work but they should make a little bit bigger one for larger people.
customer_reviews.author: Michael T. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Does the job! Secret potty!
customer_reviews.text: Works good in the spring, but composting doesn’t work well in the winter. Had to wrap the bottom in heater wire to keep it useable. Beats a black water tank!
customer_reviews.author: DIYDynamo

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for the buck!!!!
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I live totally off grid and when it comes to sanitation, you can't go wrong with this toilet. The 12v fan is quiet and uses very little power. The toilet is easy to clean and maintain. Yeah, it's a tad on the expensive side but worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Denise L

customer_reviews.title: Don't know what we would do without it.
customer_reviews.text: We use this as an extra bathroom in our 1 bath house. Saved $5-6,000 installing plumbing for a 2nd bathroom. Very little maintenance required. When we go boating, I just unsnap it from the floor, and put in on the patio boat. Way easier than the old "port-a-potty" that has to be emptied and cleaned each trip. When we get back home , just carry it back in the house, snap it to the floor and continue using it. There is absolutely no smell, and the compost can be used in the flower bed. I put a little RV toilet treatment in the urine bottle, so there is no smell there.
customer_reviews.author: Len Mullen

customer_reviews.title: So much less mess than using black tanks!
customer_reviews.text: Great product, great customer service to answer questions. Perfect thing for our skoolie.
customer_reviews.author: Margie

customer_reviews.title: Great portable toilet...
customer_reviews.text: Great for a schoolie conversion. No smell, just keep the electric connection going for the 12 volt fan and it works great. Check out you tube if any questions on this product. That’s where I found information. Wish this was less pricy though more would buy it.
customer_reviews.author: E

customer_reviews.title: Expensive
customer_reviews.text: Really expensive for what you get. Don't get me wrong it works but it is just a little high
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Holman

customer_reviews.title: Good quality product
customer_reviews.text: The fan venting could be improved to include a well designed vent cap that connects easily to the vent hose.
customer_reviews.author: Roger Larson

customer_reviews.title: Added Convenience!
customer_reviews.text: Have only used it for one two night trip but seemed to work fine. Having gone grime a cheap toilet that I only used to urinate in, I feel like a “Queen on a Throne!” Plus, now that I have a partner to travel with me, he seems much more pleased to have the ac”commod”ation no pun intended!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I love NOT having to empty a nasty black tank. As a single user I only have to empty it once a month! No smell ever! I would advise hooking the fan as if you don't then moisture can build up in the peat moss chamber which makes it hard to 'churn' it with the handle. This area needs to stay dry...
customer_reviews.author: Stephen E.

customer_reviews.title: Love love love
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use and clean. The installation was fairly simple. Very good quality. It is thoroughly enjoyed in our fifth wheel. The best part is you can't smell it and do not have to deal with a black tank.
customer_reviews.author: Schmaddie

customer_reviews.title: It is awesome. A few years ago I crinkled my nose ...
customer_reviews.text: It is awesome. A few years ago I crinkled my nose at the very idea of a composting toilet. My partner educated me on how actually cool they are and we gave it a try for our barn. It's great! No weird smells. No plumbing needed! And no water polluted. I'm a huge fan.
customer_reviews.author: L. Leland

customer_reviews.title: This product needs a redesign. It’s impossible to keep ...
customer_reviews.text: This product needs a redesign. It’s impossible to keep the liquids out of the solids container. The compartments need to be set further apart, or have a ridge between them. It requires constant wiping and spraying in order to keep clean.
customer_reviews.author: shelly huffman

customer_reviews.title: No bad odor.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, not too hard to clean. Has no bad odor, even when cleaning it out.
customer_reviews.author: Nana Preston

customer_reviews.title: Comes assembled and ready to use when you add media and  install.
customer_reviews.text: Ease of use! Haha! Excellent product easy to install and vent out no odors and good for the female gender!
customer_reviews.author: Heather Linford expert

customer_reviews.title: Buy one!
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed with the natures head!!! High quality, easy to keep clean. Does not smell at all and the vent fan uses next to no power at all! Buy one if you need a toilet like this!!!
customer_reviews.author: Justin Welles

customer_reviews.title: Worth the investment
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this toilet for my travel trailer after watching one of the Tiny House series. Always wanted a better way to manage the "black tank situation". It was fairly easy to install, and watching you tube videos gave me ideas for venting (which I did straight through the back wall of my travel trailer). Simple to use, less maintenance than the black tank, and my camping season is now extended: I can use the toilet even when the travel trailer is winterized !!!
customer_reviews.author: Valens M. Plummer

customer_reviews.title: Would definitely recommend!!!
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to use. Love the way it separates #1 & #2. Love that there is no smell, compost effectively. Would definitely recommend!!!
customer_reviews.author: Nyssa Colleen Henderson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent choice for ease of use and water conservation -- and painless to deal with!
customer_reviews.text: I can't overstate how well this composting toilet works. Probably my enthusiasm comes from years of struggling with an Envirolet composting toilet, and hating the thing, mainly because it was so difficult to clean. The Nature's Head is very, very easy to clean. There's no odor. The pee jug has to be emptied about every six days when one person is using the toilet full time. We've emptied the main compartment twice now in three months, and the job wasn't offensive. What a difference the urine-diverting system makes! We live in a desert climate where conserving water is important.
customer_reviews.author: Redpoll

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty cut and dry as far as installation. No foul odors, and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: I wasn't sure if I would like it, but after using it for a week ...
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure if I would like it, but after using it for a week I love it. It's top quality! The company is super great to deal with. I was missing two of the knobs that connected the toilet to the floor and they quickly sent them out to me. Great product! Expensive, but worth it. You get what you pay for I guess.
customer_reviews.author: Julie B.

customer_reviews.title: I have enjoyed reading it
customer_reviews.text: Shipment arrived quickly and product is everything reviews have described. Added bonus has been "The Humanure Handbook" included with the order. I have enjoyed reading it. Thanks!!!
customer_reviews.author: Julie A. Hopkins

customer_reviews.title: Extremely satisfied with my purchase
customer_reviews.text: Far superior to having to deal with a black water system
customer_reviews.author: me

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Works great, such an improvement over the porta potty. Will be getting a second urine tank.
customer_reviews.author: booklove

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Best thing since sliced bread. We put it in our boat and it has worked out wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: William P Thornton

customer_reviews.title: Good so far
customer_reviews.text: I really needed this and its holding up to my expectations so far!
customer_reviews.author: Maddie

customer_reviews.title: Excelent Composting. Toilet Love how easy it is to take care of.
customer_reviews.text: I love this composting toilet. No plumbing lines under the floor. Or crawling under the house to "break Up" the dried _____ left in the line come spring. Like the bigger plumed in composting toilets. No leaking or spilling trays. And it sure beats the cheap 'camping' type toilet that has to be emptied nearly every day.
customer_reviews.author: E. Foster

customer_reviews.title: I recommend this over holding tank a thousands time
customer_reviews.text: Product came way faster than expected and all was well in the box. The head does the job it is for and I couldn’t be happier to go compost for the boat. It’s a game changer.
customer_reviews.author: Pascal Guimond

customer_reviews.title: Very well made.
customer_reviews.text: Very well made, I would recommend it to anyone who is looking for a good option to a conventional toilet.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I installed it in my trailer, but have not used it yet. Looks to be well made.
customer_reviews.author: Lancer 18

customer_reviews.title: Love everything about this composting toilet
customer_reviews.text: Love everything about this composting toilet. I live aboard my 50 ft houseboat full-time and glad not to pumping out the black water tank all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Barb Oliver

customer_reviews.title: We love our new toilet
customer_reviews.text: We love our new toilet. It was easy to set up, we bought the regular plug in for the fan, so much easier then running 20 ft of wiring in our rv. No smell whatsoever, except the urine, dumping that is kinda nasty. Just a small price to pay for it.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product!
customer_reviews.text: As advertised. This is clean, no smell, and easy to service.
customer_reviews.author: Peter A.

customer_reviews.title: Maybe worth $300 at most. Not $900+.
customer_reviews.text: I've been wanting this product for months, did a lot of research, ultimately purchased it because all of the informed reviewers say it's currently the best composting loo on the market although some specific improvements need to be made, but it's certainly not worth almost $1,000. So right after I ordered it, I felt the sting of $1,000 and immediately began the return process. I'm going with the 5-gallon bucket-sawdust method until a better composting loo becomes available on the market.
customer_reviews.author: Marie

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful product!
customer_reviews.text: Love this toilet in our converted school bus. My only comomaint is the urnine tank is small and we are a family of 4. The stool aide never smells, the product works GREAT. We found connecting a battery to the fan didnt do as well as plugging into house power.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine Bleish

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome! Been using about a month outside to make sure we wanted to make this change. Ready to replace conventional toilets inside now! No more plungers, snakes and plumbers for us!!! There is no odor.
customer_reviews.author: Dulcime

customer_reviews.title: Yes it’s expensive, and yes it’s worth it.
customer_reviews.text: If you’ve bought from Tumi, or Yeti, or Apple and been happy paying the premium for their products, then you’ll be happy with this toilet. If you’ve regretted paying a premium, or not bought from those companies because of price, you should stay with a regular toilet. I like not using water to flush, repurposing the black water tank to extra gray capacity, and the solid feel of the Head.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Hubbard

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Perfect. I live off grid in an RV and have been using a homemade composting toilet, bucket and sawdust. I love this new toilet, no smell, easy install, no more nasty condensation on the toilet lid or maggots. The fan and exhaust hose keeps it dry and smell free. I still compost like I did before so no change there only it is cleaner and easier now. Compost dump/change time frame has gone from every week to every month, thank you, thank you. I recommend this product for everyone off-grid and on.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: But other than that love that.
customer_reviews.text: Thinking of putting a 2 x 4 base with a three-quarter inch plywood flooring underneath that to lift it up a few inches. But other than that love that.
customer_reviews.author: TheHayeser

customer_reviews.title: Great toilet!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install, works great. Just follow the directions...don't improvise. Very easy to maintain. Using this as a primary toilet in an outbuilding as our house is being rebuilt due to a fire. I can't recommend it enough.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Brislin

customer_reviews.title: instructions are detailed and set up is easy. I like the spider handle
customer_reviews.text: Seems extremely tough, instructions are detailed and set up is easy. I like the spider handle. It's a little short, if you want it to feel like a traditional household toilet I'd recommend putting it up on a raised base.
customer_reviews.author: ProjectPair

customer_reviews.title: easy to install
customer_reviews.text: easy to install; easy to use; easy to empty; fits our tiny bathroom just right. well made; sturdy; easy to wipe off or rinse; great product
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really nice toilet!
customer_reviews.text: This works really well! We love this toilet more than the electric toilet we were dealing with and it is far less expensive for every day use!
customer_reviews.author: Penny Sumner

customer_reviews.title: The human litter box
customer_reviews.text: I told my brother I want going to adopt any more cats because I didn't want to maintain a litter box and then he pointed out that I bought a human litter box. I still like it but plan to use it only for emergency goes.
customer_reviews.author: Earthstar

customer_reviews.title: Exeeded my expectations!
customer_reviews.text: Best purchase we've ever made for our FT RV life! Been using it for over 2 months now and we haven't had one complaint about it! No smell, easy to use, easy to dump and clean the urine jug too. With 2 of us we dump the urine every 2 days and empty the composting containment every 3 weeks. Even when doing that it only smells of soil not poo. I use 1 brick of coco coir per change. I'll never go back to an rv toilet or regular in house toilet for that matter. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Tamara Giacomozzi

customer_reviews.title: IT'S GREAT
customer_reviews.text: Hooked up nature's head in our camper van and used it on a three day trip. It performed just as expected. Couldn't be any happier.
customer_reviews.author: sq dancer

customer_reviews.title: I am very satisfied with this toilet so far
customer_reviews.text: I am very satisfied with this toilet so far. I have had it for a few months in my jewelers studio and have not had any problems with it. It does not have any bad odor and works as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Diane

customer_reviews.title: A great product
customer_reviews.text: Every RV and boat should have one! I'm seriously thinking of installing one in my home! Very well designed and made.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: No more having to use out house!
customer_reviews.text: Works just like it says. Easy to install. No plumbing necessary! Hard to believe, but it doesn't smell bad at all. Fits in our tiny home perfectly and doesn't take up much space. Comfy enough toilet seat.
customer_reviews.author: JacobLaura

customer_reviews.title: Great toilet
customer_reviews.text: This has worked wonderfully for my backyard office! Easy set up, no smell.
customer_reviews.author: sswoll

customer_reviews.title: Good crapper.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome pooper. Very compact but perfect height for a 6' tall dude. Also as a dude, your junk does not "touch down" when you sit like some other manufacturers. Big plus. Price seems insane until you check out the competition.
customer_reviews.author: David Baker

customer_reviews.title: Happy to crappy
customer_reviews.text: Awesome composting toilet. Easy to install and works better than I could have imagined. I highly recommend Natures head composting toilet as it has proven to me to be worth every cent it cost.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Lee Langston

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely fantastic
customer_reviews.text: Works perfect on our sailboat absolutely zero smells. Best investment on our sailboat so far. Superior Quality Construction.
customer_reviews.author: Tiny Living

customer_reviews.title: A well designed simple compact and portable composting toilet.
customer_reviews.text: Water is for drinking. It is rapidly becoming too scarce to waste on flushing toilets. The out house, it turns out, was a much better idea than we realized years ago, This is a lot smaller than an out house, and you don't have to dig a big hole. Getting as intimate with your poop as you must to empty it, is good for your sense of personal humility. You will also have an abundance of very good compost for your roses. There will be somewhat more water for people. to drink for a little bit longer into the future, if you get one of these. For five stars, it would have to empty itself.
customer_reviews.author: George E. Robertson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for rv.......almost.
customer_reviews.text: Simple design. Works as is expected. No odors. Overpriced IMHO. Quick to install and make user ready. Bottom line.....It serves the need I had which was eliminating the waste tank in my rv.
customer_reviews.author: stb

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for our guest cabin
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for our guest cabin! Have been using it for over a month and it works fine. No odor at all, used by one person in a one room cabin (12x20) enclosed behind a screen. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: DGG

product_meta.title: Nature's Head Self Contained Composting Toilet with Close Quarters Spider Handle Design
product_meta.description: The Nature's Head Composting Toilet is the latest design, the best value, and the most reliable choice for portable, self contained, urine separating dry toilets -- on the water, on the land, or on the road." "This toilet or head, (the marine term for toilet) was designed by two long time sailors who sought to create a more user friendly version than anything else on the market. While we designed our product to withstand the harsh marine environment, it can be used anywhere you need a toilet, especially anywhere that plumbing or electricity is difficult or non-existent -- on RVs or campers, in vacation cabins, workshops, barns, yurts, even trucks. Most importantly, this toilet doesn't have the foul odors associated with all other holding tank systems. The low volume air circulation fan built into the head provides the added benefit of recycling the air in your bathroom which helps make your whole environment smell better. Because it was originally designed for marine use, its rugged design and materials (all stainless hardware) it has been proven to be extremely durable no matter what your environment.
feature_bullets: No one - and I mean no one - will beat my customer service and individual support
Easy to install by any reasonably handy person.
Absolutely No Odor. No Maintenance. 5 Year Warranty.
Huge Capacity. 2 people using full time will empty every 4-6 weeks. Easy empty in 5 minutes.
A vast improvement over older composting toilet designs. This one works!

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars317 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
